Class Property

  • java.lang.Object
    • sait.mls.problemdomain.property.Property
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommercialProperty, ResidentialProperty

    public abstract class Property
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class Description: This class represents any property.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    dwatson
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      private static long serialVersionUID 
      (package private) java.lang.String zone
      A String representing the zoning laws applied to the property, Valid values are R1, R2, R3, R4, I1, I2, I3, I4

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • id

        long id
        Unique identifier for each property. Self generated field. When adding a property enter 0 the id will be calculated. For searching the id may be specified to find a unique record.

      • legalDescription

        java.lang.String legalDescription
        A String containing the legal description of the property has a maximum length of 20 characters

      • address

        java.lang.String address
        A String containing the address of the property that is offered for sale. Maximum length of 80 characters

      • quadrant

        java.lang.String quadrant
        A String indicating the quadrant in which the property is located Valid values are NW, NE, SW, SE

      • zone

        java.lang.String zone
        A String representing the zoning laws applied to the property, Valid values are R1, R2, R3, R4, I1, I2, I3, I4

      • askingPrice

        double askingPrice
        A double representing the price that is being ask for the property

      • comments

        java.lang.String comments
        A String containing additional comments regarding the property. Maximum of 200 characters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Property

        public Property()
        Default constructor

      • Property

        public Property(long id,
                java.lang.String legalDescription,
                java.lang.String address,
                java.lang.String quadrant,
                java.lang.String zone,
                double askingPrice,
                java.lang.String comments)
         throws InvalidLegalDescriptionException
        Parameters:
        id - - unique value calculated or enter zero if new property.
        legalDescription - - property description of max. 20 characters.
        address - - property address of max. 80 characters.
        quadrant - - city location with valid entries NE,NW,SE,SW.
        zone - - applied zoning with valid entries R1,R2,R3,R4,I1,I2,I3,I4.
        askingPrice - - price property is listed for.
        comments - - general comments on the property.
        Throws:
        InvalidLegalDescriptionException - when legal description does not follow the pattern where [0-9999][A-Z][0-9999][-][0-99]

      • validateLegalDescription

        private void validateLegalDescription(java.lang.String desc)
                               throws InvalidLegalDescriptionException
        A method which validates a legal description of a property. The legal description is the following: 8674X2034-61. The first part will contain a value between 0 and 9999 then a character followed by another value between 0 and 9999 then a "-" and finally a value between 0 and 99.
        Parameters:
        desc - the legal description string to be validated.
        Throws:
        InvalidLegalDescriptionException - when legal description does not follow the pattern where [0-9999][A-Z][0-9999][-][0-99]
